title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Industrial Engineering and Manufacturing Technologists

content.rendered:
What is an Industrial Engineering and Manufacturing Technologist?

Industrial Engineering and Manufacturing Technologists use their knowledge of engineering theory to creatively solve problems concerning industrial or manufacturing processes.

Where does an Industrial Engineering and Manufacturing Technologist work?

  • Manufacturing companies
  • Repair companies
  • Healthcare organizations

How much does an Industrial Engineering and Manufacturing Technologist make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for an Industrial Engineering and Manufacturing Technologist is $47,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Industrial Engineering and Manufacturing Technologists?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Mechanical engineering majors
  • Industrial engineering majors
  • General engineering majors
Search relevant roles

Industrial Engineering and Manufacturing Technologist skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Industrial Engineering and Manufacturing Technologists succeed in their work:

  • Great mathematical skills
  • Creativity and design skills
  • Great teamwork and collaboration skills

What are some common questions about Industrial Engineering and Manufacturing Technologists?

Q: How do I get an Industrial Engineering internship?

A: Check out our tips and tricks here.
